column1: short on middle, rocks back and pulls in front of square
length, angled away, attempts to sweep it but has to fetch it from well outside off and misses
full on middle, pushed back
full on the pads, tucked away to deep squareleg
full on middle, pushed to midwicket
full on the pads, skips down the wicket and pushes it to the right of deep midwicket
googly and appeal as he plays across the line, but struck him pretty high
full on middle, out comes the sweep to the left of short fine-leg who puts in a timely dive
length on middle, pushed back
full on middle, pushed to long-on
short on middle, pulled to deep squareleg without much timing. Hit high on the bat
length ball on off, doesn't know which way it's spinning, just lunges out and throws his bat at it and spoons a simple catch to cover
length outside off, goes for big booming drive, gets an outside edge but the keeper fails to collect
length on off, defended to cover
length on the pads, tucked away to squareleg
length on middle, pushed to the right up of the bowler and down to long-on
length on middle, lofted just over mid-off's head
down the wicket, he shortens his length and follows the batsman, catches him high on the bat with no room to free his arms and that's Kuhnemann's first wicket
length, angled in, tucked away to deep squareleg
length on middle, pushed to cover off the backfoot
length, angled in, tickled away to the right of short fine-leg using the pace, gets two
length outside off, googly, extra bounce and beats the batsman's outside edge
length, angled in and helped along aerially towards deep squarleg where Bryant comes running in, puts in a timely dive and gobbles it inches off the ground. Excellent catch made to look easy
full on middle, stifled appeal as it strikes the batsman on the front pad, but it was probably missing leg
length outside off, skips down the wicket and pushes it to long-off
full on middle, pushed to mid-off
length on middle, pushed firmly to mid-off
length on middle, opens the face and pushes it to cover
length outside off, bit of spin and that allows him to free his arms a little and he punches it firmly between cover and mid-off giving neither fielder any chance
length on middle, pushed to midwicket
full outside off, driven hard past the bowler's left and down to the long-off boundary where McCullum gives chase and saves the boundary with a dive
length on middle, inside edge back onto his pads
length outside off and through the line goes Bancroft to lift it over mid-off
length outside off and slashed past point's left for another boundary
slower ball on middle, tries to turn it around but gets a bit of a leading edge back to the bowler. All along the ground, however
length, angled in, Bancroft made room, the bowler followed him and played into the batsman's hands by doing so, as he just helped it along to the fine-leg boundary
short on off stump, sits up at waist height and Marsh swivels to put it away to the square leg boundary
makes himself room to drive a full, middle-stump ball to sweeper cover
flat, speared in on a good length on off stump, not much turn. Stays back and clips to long-on
back of a length, angling down leg. Shuffles across to tuck it into the fine leg region
short outside off, ended up too far from the line in an attempt to make room. Slashes and misses
short, quickish ball down leg, pulled to deep backward square leg
fullish on middle and leg, looked like the front-of-the-hand legbreak. Shows the full face to pick up a single to long-on
full on the pads, tucked away to deep squareleg
length outside off, down the wicket and pushes it aerially just wide of cover
length outside off, there was a big load-up from the batsman but he pushes it to cover
short outside off, rocks back and cuts it between point and short third-man
length on middle, skips down the wicket and turns it with his wrists to wide long-on
length outside off, pushed to long-off
slower ball on middle, dragged down, rocks back and pulls, always looking to hit it in the air but mistimed straight down deep midwicket's throat
short ball on middle, controls the pull, along the ground to midwicket
length ball, drifting down, Bancroft looks to tickle it down to fine-leg but gets very little bat on it on the way to the keeper
length outside off, pushed to deep cover
slower ball on the pads, pushed to long-on
full toss, pushed down the ground
length, angled away, uses the depth of the crease and pushes it to long-on
full outside off, pushed to cover
length onto the pads, tucked away to short fine and they scamper a single
full on middle, makes room and pushes it to long-off
length on middle, pushed to the right of cover
length on off, quicker one, late cut wide of deep point
short outside off, pushed to deep point
quicker one on middle, Bancroft back away but almost gives himself too much room and is also beaten by the extra zip on the delivery, as it dislodges the bails
full on the pads, turned to the left of midwicket
full on middle, pushed back to the bowler
googly, slower, outside off, bit of extra bounce as he beats the outside edge with the batsman attempting a cut shot
full on the pads, flicked to deep squareleg
full on off, pushed to long-off
full on middle, pushed to deep midwicket
full outside off, drilled straight to cover
full toss on middle, pushed to long-on
length on middle, pushed to long-on off the backfoot
slower ball, tucked away off the hip to deep squareleg
short outside off, slashed away past the right of point and it races to the fence
length on middle, pulled along the ground to deep squareleg
short ball, pulled but not off the middle, trickles down to deep midwicket
slower ball just outside leg, the batsman fails to get any bat on it but they they come through for a bye as the keeper fumbles
slower ball outside off, attempts to cut it but gets an inside edge back to the keeper
short one on middle, got inside the line to hook, but beaten by the pace
full toss, the batsman falls over on the sweep
length on middle, swatted wide of long-on
length on middle, hammered down to long-on where the fielder fumbles
full toss, swatted to long-off
full outside off, comes down the wicket and pushes it long-off
full on middle, and hammered down the ground where long-on comes around to cut it off with a slide
slower ball on middle, makes room and lofts it to long-on
slower ball, short and on leg stump, picked up over short fine-leg but without much timing, as the deep squareleg cuts it off
short on middle, swatted to the left of long-on
full on middle, pushed down to long-on, the lack of timing allows two
slower ball on middle, rocks back and bisects deep midwicket and deep squareleg
full on the pads, flicked wide of deep midwicket
full outside off, swatted to long-off, had to reach out a little
length outside off, and too wide
length outside off, making the left hander fetch it, only gets a thick inside edge to deep midwicket
length outside off, swing to the leg side but the line ensures that he has to fetch it and only manages a leading edge to short third-man who did not have to move an inch to take that
length, angled in, pushed to long-on
yorker outside off, the batsman shuffles across to try and launch it to the legside, just about manages to dig it out
full outside off, swing and a miss
slower ball, length outside off, ungainly swing to the legside but misses again
length outside off, swatted to long-on hard and flat, McCullum had it for a moment and then it popped out at the last instant. Fairly simple chance
yorker curving back in, squeezed out to short fine-leg
length outside off, dragged between deep squareleg and deep midwicket
length outside off, throws his bat at it but it was much too wide and ends up spooning a simple catch to long-off
full toss on middle, pushed to long-on
length, angled away, shuffles across to scoop it over the short fine-leg but got it too high on the bat and on to his body
short on middle, pulled to midwicket
slower ball outside off, swing and a miss as he goes through the stroke much earlier
slower ball, yorker outside off, can't get under it
length outside off, swatted over long-on, who just turns around to fetch it
length outside off, has to drag it as he looks to go big, doesn't get nearly enough power behind it and it just hangs in the air for deep midwicket to settle under and take it with ease

that's a hat-trick for Lalor. Length on middle, swings to the leg side but only gets a top edge high in the air for the keeper to gobble it up. He had taken the wicket of Tye off the last ball of his last over
length down the leg side and wide
length on middle, nearly chopped on but they scamper a single
yorker curving back in and beaten on the inside edge
length outside off, steered to point
full toss outside off, pushed to deep cover with no timing and that allows two
length on the pads, tickled to short fine-leg
full outside off, driven to the left of mid-off
length outside off, steered to point
length outside off, cuts but the lack of bounce and width means he is beaten on the inside edge
full on the pads, flicked to short midwicket
length outside off, steered to straight to point
full outside off and caressed past the left of mid-off
length, angled in, deflected off the pad  to short fine-leg
full on off, big load-up from Cutting but only gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
length outside off, bit of movement away, ugly swing and miss
length on the pads and he has helped it along by shuffling across to the off stump and picked it up over short fine-leg
length outside off, flashes hard and gets an outside edge over short third-man
length on middle, defended back
length outside off, flashes and it sounds like he has smashed the cover off it, turned down by the umpire
length outside off, flashes without moving his feet again and misses by a long long way
length outside off, moving away off the seam, a tentative poke from Bryant and beaten again
length on off, pushed to cover with soft hands and they scamper a single
length outside off, swatted over the cover field
dragged down, drifting in, picked up over short fine-leg but not off the middle
length, angled in, pushed to midwicket
length ball, angled in, skips down the wicket and presents his pad
quicker one outside off, cuts on trajectory not length and is beaten
down the wicket, slows it up and throws it wide, deceived Cutting in the flight but he goes through with the stroke, only managing an outside edge that carries to short third-man
full outside off, stretches out and defends with bat and pad close
length outside off, pushed to cover
full on off, defended solidly to mid-off
length on middle, tries to tuck it away to squareleg but gets an inside edge back on his body
length on middle, swatted to midwicket
full on off, pushed to mid-off
inswinger on middle, Bryant is struck on the front pad, stifled appeal turned down
short ball, angled in and helped over short fine-leg
length, angled in, tucked away to short fine-leg
length outside off, spinning away, pushed to cover
dragged down on middle, rocks back and pulls, and it carries just over the deep midwicket
in-between length outside off, drew him forward this time and beats the outside edge
full toss on the pads, picked up to the right of deep square-leg and into the boundary even though it wasn't perfectly timed
full outside off, pushed to cover
short on middle, goes back and turns it to midwicket
full on middle, drilled back to the bowler
short down the legside, helped along wide of deep squareleg
short outside off, punched to the left of deep cover
length outside off, punched to point
length, angled in, tucked away with soft hands to deep midwicket
short outside off and slapped over deep cover
full toss on off squeezed back to the bowler
length outside off, swatted over point and to the right of third-man
full outside off but can't get it past mid-off
full on middle, pushed to long-on
short on middle, turned around to deep midwicket
googly on middle, picked up with a strong bottom hand and it muscled over deep midwicket
short ball on middle, tucked away to deep midwicket
full outside off, driven to the right of deep cover which allows two
full outside off, pushed straight to deep cover
full and wide outside off and called
overpitched outside off and Lynn goes flat over extra cover and clears the boundary with ease
slower ball, length outside off, slash and a miss
full on off, driven to the right of deep cover
slower ball off the back of the hand outside off, chopped away to point
short outside off, Lynn can't reach it with both feet off the ground, neither can the keeper
slower ball, full on off, hammered back past the bowler, nearly cleaning him up and races to the fence, bisecting long-off and long-on
short outside off and slapped straight to cover. Either side off the fielder, with the power behind the stroke, it was a certain boundary
full down the leg, McCullum tries to tap it on its head but misses
full toss on the pads and flicked to deep squareleg
full toss on middle, pushed to long-off
length on off, McCullum jumps down the wicket and hammers it back to the bowler
length outside off, attempted reverse sweep but gets it off the glove back on to his pad
full on the pads, pushed to long-on
length on the pads, tickled down to fine-leg off the pads for four
length outside off, comes down the track and slaps it through point
full and angled in, through McCullum as he gave himself room to smash it through the off side. Brilliant yorker
full on off, defended to point with an angled bat
full outside off, stretches out and defends it to cover
full on off, pushed back to the bowler
length on off, pushed to long-off
overpitched outside off, driven to the left of deep cover
length on off, turned around towards midwicket, the bowler has to run around and retrieve it
length outside off and too wide
length outside off, pushed to cover
length outside off, pushed to point
full on middle, drilled back to the bowler, who nonchalantly picks it up with his left hand in his follow through
full outside off and hammered past long-off's left
full toss on middle, pushed back to the bowler

yorker outside off, tries to squeeze it out and is beaten. There's a stifled appeal and they have gone to the third umpire to see if he hit it and if it was a bump ball or not. Soft signal is not out. Looks like the sound was the bat hitting in the ground after the ball had already passed the bat. The not out call stands
full toss outside off, hammered down the ground to long-off
short outside off, pushed to deep cover
length on middle, shuffles across and pushes it to midwicket
full toss on off, pushed to deep cover
length on middle, spinning back in, the batsman is struck on the front pad but missing leg
length on middle, lunges forward and pushes it to midwicket
length and drifting in to the pads, clipped to deep squareleg
full outside off, defended to point
full outside off, crunched to the right of deep cover
full on middle and that's come out of nowhere!. Just an extension of defence, bit of a check-drive and the timing carries it over the fence with ease
knocked him over!. Excellent yorker, tails back in and he can't jam his bat down on it in time.
full toss, angled in from wide off the crease, pushed to long-on
full on off, reverse sweep, connects well but straight to short third-man
length on off, pushed back to the bowler
full outside off, inviting the drive and the batsman obliges, pushing it wide off long-off
length on middle, shuffles across and defends to midwicket
full outside leg and he somehow manages to reverse sweep it along the ground to deep cover
full toss on leg stump, pushed to deep squareleg with soft hands, they turn around for the second and a better throw might have had him. Instead, it's Lynn's fifty off just 38 balls
length, angled in, and he steers it audaciously late over the keeper
length outside off, slapped past point but straight to third-man
length on middle and and what a way to finish things off. That hung high up in the air forever but also had more than enough distance and that's the win for the Heat
